Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2008 12:18AM kaydeyz wrote: Snowyday, I had the same experience with breast size...my cavity could not be more than 30% of my breast in order to qualify for the study. I'm doing the external 2x daily for 5 days. Today was day three. I'm seeing some burning now, and my incision is more sensitive than it was a week ago.
Posts.Title: Accelerated Radiation Therapy - Good Idea or Bad? amyshap momof2doxies

Posts.Content: kaydeyz wrote: I have to make a decision quickly. Has anyone participated in the NSABP-39 study with 3D conformal external beam irradiation?? I have only until Thursday AM to decide if I want to be a part of this study. I would like to hear from anyone that can share their experiences with PBI. How were the side effects? Would you do it again? Have you heard anything about recurrence? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Partial Breast Irradiation kaydeyz kaydeyz

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2008 10:39PM kaydeyz wrote: It's difficult to say if my breast is any lumpier since rads. The incision from surgery is approx 2-2.5", and I still had an area around it that was still raised and swollen (?). Also, the cavity is center and back near my chest. I'm not sure if location makes a difference. All I can say for sure is that I feel better than I ever imagined I would. The pain in my breast is minimal, and as I mentioned before, it seems that the incision and my skin are the most sensitive. Hopefully good results continue. Thanks so much for your input!

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2008 07:55PM - edited Jan 1, 2008 09:12PM by kaydeyz I am in the partial group. Treatment will likely start the 7th. I was told that side effects might not be noticeable until after treatment. I am a teacher and will have to prepare for a sub for the week of treatment as I have a 120 mile round trip each day. I am hoping to continue in the classroom after that. Did your side effects show up later as well? Thank you so much for your input!

I does seem at times I have to just sit down and take it easy for a few minutes. It's been 5 days since rads ended, and I'm wondering when/if I should expect more pain. Also curious to know if you felt 'lumpy' right away or after you had some time to heal? _kay
Posts.Title: Partial Breast Irradiation kaydeyz kaydeyz

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2008 05:36PM kaydeyz wrote: Hi Dragongal I didn't have much time to research this study as they needed an answer soon. Actually, what happened was I happened to catch a story on brachytherapy on the local news just 3 days before my rad setup. I was very interested and talked with my onc, who thought the external radiation would fit my case best.  I think I had to be signed up for treatment within 45(?) days of surgery, which gave me just a week of consideration (I had a second biopsy before rads could begin). At any rate, I gathered information from my rad onc, the research nurse, the radiation nurses that had experience with this treatment, and positive input from CherylRubie. I looked for information online also, but have no idea of the sites I visited. The study is in stage 3, and I just had a strong gut feeling that this was the way to go for me. Tomorrow is my first appt since radiation. I did neglect to mention shortness of breath as a side effect, but that is improving as well. Others have told me that is expected. I will ask my dr tomorrow. You have to do what you feel comfortable with. Good Luck to You!
Posts.Title: partial breast radiation vs whole breast radiation dragongal kuchagirl

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2008 11:33PM kaydeyz wrote: I finished the NSABP-39 study with external beam about 4 weeks ago, but was not in the prone position. I was in the group that received pbi 2x/day for 5 days. I have had good results so far. My SEs seem less severe than one would possibly receive with conventional treatment. I used Biafine and Aquaphor for the slight burn. I had light fatigue for a couple weeks that didn't interfere with work, and some shortness of breath, which is improving. My breast feels fairly normal so far, no weird lumpiness or pain! Hope this helps you!
Posts.Title: Prone Positon Partial Breast Irradiation sharonw JoniB

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2008 01:18PM kaydeyz wrote: Oh yes, my rad onc seemed optimistic about the results of this study. He said he wouldn't have recommended it if he thought it put me at risk.
Posts.Title: partial breast radiation vs whole breast radiation dragongal kuchagirl

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2008 01:08PM kaydeyz wrote: I just finished the NSABP-39 study with 3D conformal external beam irradiation 3 weeks ago, which sounds like the equivelant to your RAPID trial. I had a 50/50 chance to receive conventional radiation or partial. Wow, finally someone that might be able to relate to my experiences! Member CherylRubie has been the only person to respond to my inquiries thus far. She participated in the study in 2006. I believe you can find our conversations if you click on my name.  I am glad I was in the group that received the newer treatment. I believe my side effects have been less intense than those receiving conventional rads. I had slight burning toward the end of the 5 day treatment and developed an itchy rash a week out. The area at the incision was the worst. I wore a sports bra for a week, but then felt well enough to go back to my regular bra. I had mild fatique for a couple weeks afterward...not drop-dead tired, more like curling up with a blanket on the sofa after work and thinking about how exhausted I was! My cavity is center and back toward the chest wall, and is approx the size of an egg, but my breast still looks and feels normal at this time. Three weeks out and I'm feeling good. No pain. Like Cheryl told me, once lumpectomy and radiation was experimental, and now we know it is as good as a mastectomy. I have 2 daughters, and I hope this treatment will benefit them should they land in my shoes. I am hoping for the best results possible, and wish the same for you! Keep me posted!
Posts.Title: partial breast radiation vs whole breast radiation dragongal kuchagirl
